alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Aroostook County through 1100 AM EDT... At 1012 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Reed Plantation, or 12 miles west of Danforth, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Danforth, Hodgdon, Amity, Haynesville, Cary Plantation, Wytopitlock, Reed Plantation, Weston, Cary, Reed, Orient, Macwahoc, Bancroft, Glenwood, Forkstown, Drew Plantation and North Amity. This includes US Highway 1 between Orient and Cary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook
